  • Constructor Details

    • CombatZoneChooseBatteries

      public CombatZoneChooseBatteries(Card_Combat_zone cardC, ArrayList<Consequences> remaining, CombatZoneState prevState, Player player, int numbattoloose) throws Exception
      Constructs a new instance of the CombatZoneChooseBatteries state. This state represents a phase where a player needs to choose how many batteries to place during a combat zone interaction.
      Parameters:
      cardC - The combat zone card associated with this state.
      remaining - A list of remaining consequences to be processed in this combat interaction.
      prevState - The previous state before transitioning to this state.
      player - The player who is currently making decisions in this state.
      numbattoloose - The number of batteries required to lose in this phase.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the transition or initialization of this state.

  • Method Details

    • goNextState

      public void goNextState(Player p) throws Exception
      Advances the state of the current combat zone by transitioning to the next appropriate state based on the remaining consequences. If no consequences remain, the combat zone transitions to its final state.
      Overrides:
      goNextState in class Card_State
      Parameters:
      p - the player whose state is used during the transition process
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the state transition

    • chooseToPlaceBatteries

      public void chooseToPlaceBatteries(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posBatAndNumBattXPos) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose and place batteries on their ship during the combat phase. This method checks if the player's input related to battery positioning is valid and progresses the game state or handles incorrect inputs accordingly.
      Overrides:
      chooseToPlaceBatteries in class Card_State
      Parameters:
      p - The player who is attempting to place the batteries.
      posBatAndNumBattXPos - A list of positions and the corresponding number of batteries to be placed. Each inner list contains details about the position and battery count.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during the validation or state progression process.
